variants.Description in input context: L166P mutation associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: Stable HEK293 cell lines expressing wild-type and mutant DJ-1 were used.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant showed 90% reduced protein stability compared to wild-type
L166S mutant showed 60% reduced protein stability compared to wild-type

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate for quantification.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed Student's t-test with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression â‰¥ 80% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: Fibroblasts from Parkinson's disease patients with L166P mutation were used.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P fibroblasts showed increased oxidative stress markers

Biological replicates.Description: Fibroblasts from three independent patients were analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Control fibroblasts from healthy donors used as positive controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oxidative stress markers within 1.5x normal range
